content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is the function that will do what you asked for:

```julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = Markdown.parse(md).content
    codeblocks = filter(x -> x isa Markdown.Code, blocks)
    return join([string(block.lang, "\n", block.code) for block in codeblocks], "\n")
end
```

This function works by parsing the markdown string into a list of content elements using `Markdown.parse()`. It then filters out non-code blocks and extracts the code blocks, joining them together with newline characters.

Please note that you need to have the "Markdown" package installed in your Julia environment to use this function. You can add it via:
```julia
using Pkg
Pkg.add("Markdown")
```
